answers.answer: I really don't think there is anything your doctor could do! But I've had 2 smaller babies one 4lb15oz at 34 weeks and the other 5lbs4oz at 38 weeks but they we're both very healthy and had no problems what so ever! Good luck to you hope everything goes well and always remember the ultrasound can be off by up to 2lbs I've heard.
The only thing that can be done is in your hands really.  Just take care of yourself and heed the doctors advice.  It'll all be just fine!
Well according to the ultrasound he was 4 pounds 13 ounces but he's small I just don't want that to cause problems for him after labor n thank you

My first was 4lb15oz when she was born at 34 weeks and she was very healthy came home from the hospital 3 days after birth since I had a c-secion I think your baby should be fine just try not to stress to much since its not good for you or baby!

question: Ok so I have gestational diabetes I'm 35 weeks 2days and my baby measures at 33 weeks will the doctor do anything about it ?? I don't want him to small and to have problems when born
title: worried
